thread.title: 美国前50所顶尖商学院SAT平均分是多少？
thread.title_full: 美国前50所顶尖商学院SAT平均分是多少？

posts.author: www.qq.com
posts.title: 美国前50所顶尖商学院SAT平均分是多少？
posts.text: 0 Poets&Quants 给出的最佳本科商学院排行榜。 排名显示，排名前3的商学院其SAT录取平均分也是最高的： 圣路易斯华盛顿大学奥林商学院 WUSTL-Olin 的SAT录取平均分排名第一，达到了1480分（满分1600）。而该校在P&Q的最佳本科商学院排行榜上也是排名最高的。 紧随其后的是 圣母大学门多萨商学院 ND- Mendoza，该校的SAT录取平均分高达1460分，而宾夕法尼亚大学沃顿商学院UPenn-Wharton 以1457分的SAT平均录取成绩排在第3位。而这两所学校在本科商学院排名榜上也分别排在第2、第3的位置。 SAT平均录取成绩排在前10的这些商学院中，有7所在P&Q的最佳本科商学院排行榜上也是排名前10的。 而除了明尼苏达大学 卡尔森商学院 UMN-Carlson 之外，在最佳本科商学院排行榜上位于前15的所有学校，他们的SAT平均录取成绩都是排在最高的前20位的。 确切而言，对于绝大多数学生来说，想要入读顶尖的商学院本科项目，都要求他们能拿到一个耀眼的SAT成绩。 基于从2年前开始公布的数据，我们能追踪到前50所最佳本科商学院中的37所，关于他们6年来SAT平均录取成绩的趋势。 而根据这一趋势的显示，6年来在这37所顶尖商学院中，有30所商学院的SAT平均录取成绩都有所上升。 其中增长最多的是南卫理公会大学考克斯商学院 SMU-Cox，在过去的6年中，该学校的SAT录取平均分从1280分提高到了1450分，整整上涨了170分。 而另外2个出现3位数增长的学校是波士顿大学奎斯特罗姆商学院 BU-Questrom，该校的SAT录取平均分从1289分增长到了1408分，增长了119分，以及 东北大学达莫尔-麦金商学院 NEU-D’Amore-McKim，该校的SAT录取平均分上涨了104分（从1329分增加到了1433分）。 而紧随其后的是马萨诸塞大学艾森伯格管理学院UMASS- Isenberg，其SAT录取分数上涨了96分（从1209分涨到了1305分），差一点就要达到100分的增长了。 与此同时，也有学校的SAT录取平均分出现了下降，其中下降最多的是北卡罗来纳大学弗拉格勒商学院 UNC-Kenan-Flagler，该校的SAT录取平均成绩下降了42分（从1342分降到了1301分）。 接下来是弗吉尼亚大学麦金太尔商学院 UVA-McIntire，该校的SAT录取平均分下降了38分（从1384分降至1346分），之后是华盛顿大学福斯特商学院 UW-Foster，该校的SAT录取平均分下降了36分（从1275分降至1239分）。 尽管SAT录取成绩对于学校在P&Q的最佳本科商学院排名上起到了一定的作用，但一些录取分数较低的学校也在该榜单上有不错的排名。 其中最特别的例子就是明尼苏达大学卡尔森商学院 UMN-Carlson，该校的SAT录取成绩从6年前的1297分降到了1280分，下降了17分，因此在SAT录取成绩的排名上仅仅位列31名。 但是由于在校友评分和毕业生就业率方面的良好表现，该校商学院的本科项目综合排名也拿到了第12名。 而杨百翰大学麦里特商学院 BYU- Marriott 以1263分的SAT平均录取成绩排在录取分数榜的第34名，但也由于积极的校友反馈和就业率数据，在商学院的本科项目综合排名中获得了第20名。 与此同时，南卫理公会大学考克斯商学院 SMU-Cox 和卡内基梅隆大学 泰珀商学院 CMU-Tepper的SAT平均录取成绩均排在前5，但她们的商学院本科项目综合排名都在15名之后。 对于泰珀商学院Tepper 来说，是由于她的校友评分不太好，而对于考克斯商学院 Cox 而言，其校友评分和就业率两项评分都不太高。因此，SAT录取成绩的高低也并非是商学院整体排名的成败指标。 Average SAT Scores At the Top 50 Undergraduate Business Programs 美帝50所顶尖商学院的SAT平均分 PQ排名 学校 6年前 SAT 均分 SAT均分 (新标换算) 1 圣路易斯华盛顿大学WUSTL (Olin) 1480 1511 2 圣母大学 ND (Mendoza) 1460 1510 3 宾夕法尼亚大学Upenn (Wharton) 1457 1510 17 南卫理公会大学SMU (Cox) 1450 1500 24 卡内基梅隆大学CMU (Tepper) 1449 1500 9 纽约大学NYU (Stern) 1446 1500 5 加州大学伯克利分校UCB (Haas) 1440 1500 10 密歇根大学Umich (Ross) 1440 1500 19 东北大学NEU (D'Amore McKim) 1433 1480 4 乔治城大学Georgetown (McDonough) 1426 1490 6 康奈尔大学Cornell (Dyson) 1422 1490 26 波士顿大学BU (Questrom) 1408 1470 7 印第安纳大学IU (Kelley) 1387 1447 15 埃默里大学Emory (Goizueta) 1382 1450 13 南加州大学USC (Marshall) 1369 1440 8 弗吉尼亚大学UVa (McIntire) 1346 1420 23 伊利诺伊大学香槟分校UICU 1344 1400 11 德州大学奥斯汀分校UT-Austin (McCombs) 1337 1400 22 理海大学Lehigh 1335 1410 27 里士满大学Richmond (Robins) 1330 1400 30 马里兰大学UMD (Smith) 1315 1390 29 威斯康星大学Wisconsin 1314 1390 34 马萨诸塞大学UMASS (Isenberg) 1305 1380 28 宾州州立大学PSU (Smeal) 1304 1380 18 巴布森学院Babson 1304 1380 35 佐治亚大学Georgia (Terry) 1302 1380 16 北卡罗来纳大学UNC (Kenan-Flagler) 1301 1360 40 匹兹堡大学Pittsburgh 1300 1360 31 福特汉姆大学Fordham (Gabelli) 1300 1350 25 罗格斯大学-新布朗斯维克Rutgers-New Brunswick 1295 1370 12 明尼苏达大学UMN (Carlson) 1280 1360 32 田纳西大学Tennessee (Haslam) 1270 1350 41 俄亥俄州立大学OSU (Fisher) 1269 1350 20 杨百翰大学BYU (Marriott) 1263 1340 33 华盛顿大学UW (Foster) 1239 1320 37 德州农工大学TAMU (Mays) 1234 1300 42 康涅狄格大学UCONN 1233 1300 36 新泽西学院TCNJ 1227 1310 38 依隆大学Elon (Love) 1218 1300 21 德州基督教大学TCU (Neeley) 1188 1270

thread.title: 让人闭嘴，这8条英文表达礼貌又地道
thread.title_full: 让人闭嘴，这8条英文表达礼貌又地道

posts.author: www.qq.com
posts.title: 让人闭嘴，这8条英文表达礼貌又地道
posts.text: 0 [ 摘要 ]想要休息，但宿舍太吵？如果环境迫使你要喊shut up，那么下面这篇文章对你一定有所用处。哪怕是shut up，也可以不重样。 学习这8条英文表达，让人闭嘴显得礼貌又地道！ 想要休息，但宿舍太吵？如果环境迫使你要喊shut up，那么下面这篇文章对你一定有所用处。哪怕是shut up，也可以不重样。 1. Put a sock in it impolitely telling someone to stop talking or making a noise 不客气地让某人安静 Couldn’t you put a sock in it? I’d love to do some work, but I can’t in this noise. 能不能把嘴闭上？你太吵了，我根本无法工作。 Put a sock in it, there are people who are trying to sleep around here. 别说话，有人正准备睡觉呢。 2. Cork it / put a cork in it telling someone to be quiet 要求某人安静 It’s too late and we’re fed up with your stories –cork it and go to sleep. 夜已深，而且我们听够你的故事了——别讲了，睡吧。 Don’t you want to work instead of talking all the time? Cork it and take your tools. 滔滔不绝地说废话，难道你不打算工作么？赶紧闭嘴拿上工具干活吧。 3. Button it telling someone rudely to be quiet 粗鲁地让某人保持安静 Button it, can’t you? I’m trying to concentrate. 闭上嘴，行吗？我正努力集中精力。 If you don’t button it, I’ll get up and go away. 你再不闭嘴，我就走了。 4. Shut up / shut your pie hole a rude way to tell someone to be quiet (pie hole = mouth /slang/) 无礼地让某人安静（派口=嘴/俚语/） Shut your pie hole or I’ll shut it for you! 把嘴闭上，不然我就帮你闭上。 Shut your pie hole and mind what you’re doing! 闭嘴，看看你在做什么！ 5. Zip (up) your lip(s) / zip it up an informal way to tell someone to be quiet 让他人安静的一种非正式说法 Zip your lips, boys, and listen to me. 孩子们，安静，听我说。 We told her to be quiet, but she just couldn’t zip it up. 我们想让她安静，可她偏要讲话。 6. Wind your neck in a rude way to tell someone to be quiet and/or calm down 一种让人安/冷静的无礼说法 Cool down, buddy, wind your neck in, you’ve made enough troubles already. 冷静点，兄弟，少说几句，你惹的麻烦已经够多了。 Wind your neck in and sit quiet, we’ve taken the wrong road due to your talking nonsense. 少说几句吧，好好坐着。你的胡言乱语已经把我们带错路了。 7. Simmer down calm down after anger or excitement; an informal way to tell someone to cool down 愤怒或兴奋后平静下来。让某人冷静的非正式表达 Please don’t shout, simmer down, there’s no point in rejoicing yet. 冷静点，弟兄们，我们最好干完活在庆祝。

thread.title: 8条关于金钱的有趣习语
thread.title_full: 8条关于金钱的有趣习语

posts.author: www.qq.com
posts.title: 8条关于金钱的有趣习语
posts.text: 0 我们在日常生活中总能遇到各种和钱有关的表达， 今天来学习下面8条与金钱相关的习语，为工作日增添乐趣吧~ 1. Balance the books 1.结账、结算 determine that accounts are in balance, bring the two sides into equilibrium, settle an account by paying what is due 确定账户处于平衡状态，力求平衡，通过支付到期款来结算账户 The accountant says he can’t balance the books till our last check clears. 会记说上次的票款清理后才能给我们结账。 2.养家糊口 earn a salary, make money for your family 挣钱养家 When our parents died in an accident, and my sister and I remained alone, I had to leave college and bring home the bacon. 父母意外死亡时，我和妹妹还没成家。所以我不得不辍学养家。 3.各自付账 share the cost of something 共同支付 When I wanted to settle the bill, she insisted on going Dutch and pay for her meal. 就在我准备结账时，她坚持一起支付，并把自己那份饭钱给了我。 4.钱多活少的好差事 a source of easy money, a job that pays a lot with little work 轻易得来的钱，赚钱的清闲差事 My brother took up a job in a beach restaurant and hoped to get on board the gravy train, but in fact he had to work more than in a factory. 我哥哥在沙滩边的餐馆工作，原本以为自己找到了一份赚钱的清闲差事，可实际上，那儿的儿比工厂还多。 5.储蓄金 savings, money kept in reserve 积蓄、贮备金 Don’t worry about the job you lost. We have a little nest egg to live on until you find another. 别担心失业后的生活。我们还有一些积蓄能撑到你找到新工作。 cheat in accounting, manipulate financial records 伪造或篡改财务报表 Nobody noticed that one of the managers was cooking the books until the company got totally bankrupt. 直到公司彻底破产以后，公司有一位经理做假账的事才被人发现。 7. Golden handshake a (large) sum of money paid to an employee when he/she leaves the firm 支付给员工的一大笔离职金 Grandfather didn’t really want to retire too early, but he couldn’t resist the golden handshake that the company offered. 尽管祖父不打算早早退休，但是他未能抵住一大笔离职金的诱惑。 somebody who doesn’t like to spend money

thread.title: 比dry更地道的10种表达方式
thread.title_full: 比dry更地道的10种表达方式

posts.author: www.qq.com
posts.title: 比dry更地道的10种表达方式
posts.text: 0 There are a few different definitions for dry and each of these definitions has synonyms that we will explore. 对于单词dry的定义有很多，每一个定义都有我们要探索的同义词。 Dry can mean something lacks water, liquid, or moisture. Dry 意为缺少水分，液体或者湿度不够。 It hasn’t rained in weeks, the ground is completely dry. 几周都没下雨了，地面完全干燥了。 Her clothes were no longer dry after the rain. 雨后她的衣服都湿了。 The past tense of dry is dried. Dry的过去式是dried。 I dried my clothes last night, so that I could wear them today. Dry can also cause someone to be thirsty. 干燥也会使人感到口渴。 I’m feeling really dry from being out in the sun all day. 我一整天都在外面晒太阳，我感到很干。 Here are some words that you can substitute for this form of dry. 这里将列出一些词来代替dry。 1.Parch 烘干 Parch can mean that something is dried out because of heat. Parch意为由于高温而变得干燥。 The earth in the desert is parched. 沙漠里的土地都被烤干了。 Parch can also mean very thirsty. This is usually due to lack of water. Parch也意为非常口渴。通常是因为缺水而口渴。 I haven’t had water since this morning and I’m parched. 从早晨到现在我还没有喝水，我非常口渴。 Parch also refers to something being lightly roasted. Parch也指被轻微烤过的东西。 Yesterday I tried parched corn for the first time, which is made by dry roasting corn. 我昨天第一次尝试吃用干玉米做的烤玉米。 2.Wither 枯萎 Wither or the past tense withered, can also be substituted for dry at times. It means to shrivel, fade or decay. Often used in reference to plants lacking water and dying because of it. 有时候，wither或者它的过去式withered也可以代替dry。它的意思是枯萎，凋谢或者腐烂。通常指因此而缺水或者死亡的植物。 这是炎热的一周，植物都要枯死了。 After years of declining revenue the business finally withered. 多年以来，收入一直下降，这生意最后倒闭了。 Even after therapy our marriage withered. 即使是在努力协调之后，我们的婚姻还是破裂了。 3.Shrivel 枯萎，皱缩 Shrivel is another synonym for dry. It means to wrinkle due to lack of water. Shrivel是dry的另一种表达方式。它意为由于缺水而导致皱缩。 The grapes were left out in the sun, and they looked shriveled. 葡萄被放在阳光下，他们看起来都枯萎了。 4.Wilt 枯萎 Wilt or the past tense Wilted is another synonym for dry that applies to plants. In this case the plant would be limp and droopy because of the lack of water. Wilt或者它的过去式wilted是dry的另一种表达方式，通常用来指植物。在缺水的情况下，植物会变得松软和下垂。 我忘记给西红柿浇水了，它的叶子都枯萎了。 Wilt can also mean to lose energy. Wilt还可以意为失去能量。 Despite all of his training, he wilted at the end of the match. 尽管他进行了很多训练，最后他还是筋疲力尽了。 枯萎，凋谢 Wizen means to shrivel or wrinkle with age. Wizen的意思是随着年龄的增长而枯萎起皱。 The old woman had wizened over time. 随着时间的流失，这个老妇人身上布满了皱纹。 6.Brittle Brittle means that something is hard, but could break easily because it’s dry. Brittle意为某物很硬，但是由于它很干所以很容易被损坏。 As people get older their bones become brittle. 随着年龄的增长，人们的骨头变得很脆。 7.Empty 空的，干的

thread.title: The dangers of cyberloafing “上网闲逛”带来的隐患
thread.title_full: The dangers of cyberloafing “上网闲逛”带来的隐患

posts.author: www.qq.com
posts.title: The dangers of cyberloafing “上网闲逛”带来的隐患
posts.text: 0 点击收听音频>> 一项调查发现，目前每个工作日中14%的时间竟然被用于“上网闲逛”。在各国的办公室里，员工在上班时间查看社交媒体网站、网上购物、阅读新闻、浏览八卦等已很常见。人们为什么会养成“上网闲逛”的习惯呢？这个习惯怎么改？跟随本集《随身 英语 ( 精品课 )》了解造成人们“上网闲逛”背后的原因。 课文内容 Vocabulary: Procrastination 词汇: 延迟 Time to own up. When you’re sitting at your computer, do you work solidly all day? Or do you allow yourself to become distracted now and again… to open a few extra tabs, check social media, read a spot of news, browse the latest fashion trends, maybe catch up on some celebrity gossip, and look at some… Stop! You’re ‘cyberloafing’. The unwieldy word is a combination of ‘cyber’, which means ‘related to computers’, and ‘loafing’, which means ‘relaxing in a lazy way’. We do it, and we do it a lot. A study from the University of Texas suggests we are guilty of this form of procrastination for 14% of our working day. On a Friday afternoon, I expect it’s more than that. But it’s a slippery slope. It can damage your productivity and even your career. Because according to the Univeristy of Texas research, each time a worker gets sidetracked by the internet it takes an average of 23 minutes to get back to work. More than that, cyberloafing has a dark side, according to a report published in The Journal of Psychosocial Research on Cyberspace. It argues that cyberloafing is connected to several negative personality traits. People who cyberloaf are more likely to be manipulative, self-interested and narcissistic. Furthermore, people with these traits are less likely to feel remorse about avoiding work, and less concerned about getting caught.

thread.title: Five things invented by women 五件由女性发明的东西
thread.title_full: Five things invented by women 五件由女性发明的东西

posts.author: www.qq.com
posts.title: Five things invented by women 五件由女性发明的东西
posts.text: 0 点击收听音频>> 计算机程序设计应该是个男性工作的领域，对吗？仅从目前的从业人数来看，男性程序员的人数超过女性从业人数，但曾经一度可不是这样的。本集《随身 英语 ( 精品课 )》带你认识50年代的一位女性先锋程序员，同时介绍那些由女性发明的日用品。 课文内容 Here’s a simple challenge: name a famous inventor. Perhaps Renaissance polymath Leonardo da Vinci springs to mind. Or the pioneer of the telephone, Alexander Graham Bell. But you might be hard-pressed to name many female inventors, even though women are behind some of the most widely used technologies in the modern world. For example, where would we be without the windscreen wiper? Back on a freezing winter’s day in 1902, Mary Anderson was travelling by tram through New York city. Snow was falling, forcing the driver to stop repeatedly and get out to clear it. Each time the door opened, Mary suffered a gust of sub-zero air. She had a brainwave: why not make some kind of a rubber blade that could be operated from inside the vehicle? And that’s exactly what she did. Let’s step in from freezing New York for our next invention. The dishwasher dates back even earlier to the 19th Century, and to the dinner parties thrown by a lady called Josephine Cochrane. As a frequent host, she wanted a machine that could wash dishes faster than people. Her response was to develop what was to become the first commercially successful dishwasher. Interestingly, innovation was in her blood: her grandfather had invented the steamboat. Need something to do while the dishwasher is whirring away? How about a round of Monopoly? One of the most popular board games around, the rules were first drawn up by a lady called Elizabeth Magie, and patented in 1904. Her intention was to create a game to highlight what she saw as the pitfalls of capitalism. It was originally called The Landlord’s Game. To an altogether different kind of innovation: Kevlar is the lightweight fibre used in bulletproof vests. The material is used by millions every day and has saved countless lives. The super tough fabric is also used in objects ranging from gloves to aeroplanes to wind turbines. Incredibly, its strength-to-weight ratio is five times higher than steel. Again, it was invented by a woman, the American chemist Stephanie Kwolek, in 1964. Finally, one of the most important inventions of the 20th Century must surely be the computer programme. The world of programming is notoriously unbalanced in terms of gender. Men vastly outnumber women, and take home around 30% more pay than their female counterparts on average. But back in the 1940s and 50s, women were at the forefront of this new field. Grace Hopper is credited with inventing the first compiler in 1952, which serves as the bridge between code and the binary ones and zeros understood by computers. 词汇表 spring to mind突然呈现在脑海中 pioneer先锋 hard-pressed（由于缺少时间）面临困难的 where would we be without…假如没有…我们将会是怎样的？
